definitions.definition: A bounding straight edge of a two-dimensional shape.
A flat surface of a three-dimensional object; a face.
One half (left or right, top or bottom, front or back, etc.) of something or someone.
definitions.example: Which side of the tray shall I put it on?  The patient was bleeding on the right side.

definitions.definition: A region in a specified position with respect to something.
definitions.example: Meet me on the north side of the monument.

definitions.definition: The portion of the human torso usually covered by the arms when they are not raised; the areas on the left and right between the belly or chest and the back.
definitions.example: I generally sleep on my side.

definitions.definition: One surface of a sheet of paper (used instead of "page", which can mean one or both surfaces.)
definitions.example: John wrote 15 sides for his essay!

definitions.definition: One possible aspect of a concept, person or thing.
One set of competitors in a game.
A sports team.
A group having a particular allegiance in a conflict or competition.
definitions.example: In the second world war, the Italians were on the side of the Germans.

definitions.definition: A recorded piece of music; a record, especially in jazz.
Sidespin; english
definitions.example: He had to put a bit of side on to hit the pink ball.

definitions.definition: A television channel, usually as opposed to the one currently being watched (from when there were only two channels).
definitions.example: I just want to see what's on the other side — James said there was a good film on tonight.

definitions.definition: A dish that accompanies the main course; a side dish.
definitions.example: Do you want a side of cole-slaw with that?

definitions.definition: A line of descent traced through one parent as distinguished from that traced through another.
definitions.example: his mother's side of the family

definitions.definition: The batters faced in an inning by a particular pitcher
definitions.example: Clayton Kershaw struck out the side in the 6th inning.

definitions.definition: An unjustified air of self-importance.
A written monologue or part of a scene to be read by an actor at an audition.
A man who prefers not to engage in anal sex during homosexual intercourse.
definitions.example: My boyfriend and I are both sides, so we prefer to do oral on each other.

definitions.definition: To ally oneself, be in an alliance, usually with "with" or rarely "in with"
definitions.example: Which will you side with, good or evil?

definitions.definition: To lean on one side.
To be or stand at the side of; to be on the side toward.
To suit; to pair; to match.
To work (a timber or rib) to a certain thickness by trimming the sides.
To furnish with a siding.
To provide with, as a side or accompaniment.
To clear, tidy or sort.
